All those candidates who have passed ITI at least with one year, 10+2 Vocational, 10+2 with PCM should be eligible for consideration for lateral entry in 2nd year in various courses of Diploma in Engineering.
OR,
Candidates who have appeared/ are appearing in the qualifying ITI, 10+2 (vocational) or 10+2 PCM examination to be held in the current session shall also be eligible to apply for admission but they shall obtain the requisite qualification before the last date of admission under the scheme.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
The candidates who have passed the Standard X examination are eligible for admission for Polytechnic Colleges. Before the admission process is started, the required qualifications such as Age, Marks required, and Number of Seats in the various categories etc. are checked so that students can decide their choice of Course etc. well in advance.
OR,
HSC (Academic & Vocational) students can directly join in the second year of the three year Diploma programme under the Lateral Entry System in Polytechnics. Their intake is restricted to 20% (10% Academic + 10% Vocational) of the sanctioned intake of the 1 year Diploma courses.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
The candidates who pass SSLC (10 years of schooling) with Mathematics and Science subjects under New Regulations with eligibility for admission to the Higher Secondary Course of study(+2).
OR
Any other qualification recognised as equivalent by the Board of Secondary Education, Tamil Nadu.
Eligibility For Direct Admission To The Second Year (Lateral Entry):- For Lateral Entry into the Second Year (III Semester) of the three year Diploma Course ,the candidate shall be required to have passed the Higher Secondary Examination(+2 ), (Academic or Vocational) with the following conditions:
1. Academic stream candidates should have compulsorily studied Maths, Physics and Chemistry at the +2 level.
2. Vocational stream candidates should have studied either Maths or Physics or Chemistry as one of the subjects of study along with the related Vocational Subject. (Theory and Practical) at +2 level.
OR
10th Pass + (2 years ITI) with appropriate specialisation.

For Lateral Entry into the second year (III semester of the course) The candidates shall be required to have passed the Higher Secondary (Academic or Vocational) Examinations of 10 plus 2 pattern, with Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry as the subjects as study.
OR
A Pass in ITI 2 YEARS TRADE
OR

OR
Any other qualification recognised as equivalent to a pass in HSC or Tamilnadu Higher Schools by the Director of Secondary Education Board, Tamilnadu.
Age Limit;-
No Age Limit

College: KL Nagaswamy Memorial Polytechnic College, Madurai
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
The candidates applying for admission to Full Time Three Year Diploma Courses :
A mere pass in SSLC with eligibility for admission to 1st year of Higher Secondary School in Tamil Nadu HSC Board Schools.
OR
Any other qualification recognized as equivalent to a pass in SSLC or X Standard or Tamil Nadu High Schools by the Director of School Education/Secondary Education Board, Tamil Nadu.
Note :Candidates who are qualified as on 1-7-(year) (ie., who have passed the qualifying examination during April or earlier examination) only with become eligible for admission.
AGE LIMITS:- No Age Limit
The candidates applying for admission to 2nd Year (III Semester) Full-Time Three Year Diploma Courses:
1. A pass in HSC (academic) or (vocational) or (10th + 2 years ITI) courses mentioned in Annexure lll offered in the Higher Secondary School in Tamilnadu affiliated to the Tamilnadu Higher Secondary Board with eligibility for University courses to study.
2. Should have studied one related subject and one vocational subject consisting one theory and two Practicals ‘or’
3. Should have studied two related subjects and one vocational subject consisting of One theory and one Practical.
4. HSC (V) COMMERCIAL SUBJECT, HSC (A) COMMERCIAL SUBJECTS holders are not eligible for Engg. diploma courses.
5. Mark rule (academic) (except for commercial practice and for Printing Technology Courses)
6. A mere Pass in +2 Academic / Vocational Group / (10th + 2 years ITI).
Course_Detail: Diploma in Civil Engineering is 3 years full time course. Recognized by Directorate of Technical Education, Chennai and approved by AICTE.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
The candidates who pass Xth Standard or equivalent examinations with Mathematics and Science subjects are eligible for admission into Polytechnic Colleges.
There is no age restriction to join the Diploma Courses with effect from the academic year 2004-2005.
Lateral Entry Admissions :-
For Lateral Entry into the Second year (III Semester) of the three year diploma courses, the candidates shall be required to have passed the Higher Secondary Examination (Academic or Vocational) of 10 plus 2 pattern, with the following conditions:
1. Academic Stream candidates should have compulsorily studied Maths. Physics and Chemistry at 10th + 2 level.
2. Vocational Stream candidates should have studied either Maths or Physics or Chemistry as one of the subjects of study along with the related Vocational Subject (Theory and Practical) at 10th +2 level.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Candidate should be an Indian national and have passed the SSC (STD. X) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or it's equivalent examination with minimum of 35 % marks in best of 5 aggregate with subjects Maths, General Science & English.
For Direct Second Year Diploma Engg:
H.S.C Science (PCM/PCMB/PCB ) Pass
H.S.C With M.C.V.C
I.T.I-60%
H.S.C (SciTech. /Vocational )

Eligiblity:
ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR ADMISSION:
A) FOR ADMISSION TO FIRST YEAR DIPLOMA: SSC (10th) Std Passed With English, Science And Mathematics With At Least 35% For All Categories And Other Criteria Prescribed By DTE And MSBTE Mumbai. B)FOR DIRECT SECOND YEAR DIPLOMA: The Candidate Must Be Passed HSC / Technical / Vocational (Bi-Focal) Examination With Min. 50 % Marks In Aggregate (45% For Backward Class). The Candidate Must Have Passed The Said Examination With And In A Technical Or Vocational Subject As Prescribed By The Board Of Technical Examination, Maharashtra State For Different Courses3
FOR ITI STUDENTS: The Candidate Must Be Passed SSC Exam with Following Compulsory Subjects Mathematics, Science and English And He Or She Must Have Passed ITI With Min 60% Marks

Eligiblity:
To be eligible for admission to first year of diploma course in Engineering / Technology, the candidates should have:
Passed Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education, or any other equivalent examination with and in 1. General Science or Physics & Chemistry, 2. Mathematics or Algebra & Geometry and 3. English. Secured minimum 50% marks in aggregate, from a recognized school in Maharashtra State.
Note: The term 'Aggregate Marks' used here shall mean the grand total marks obtained by the candidate, taken together for all the subjects, whether compulsory or optional.

Jee (polytechnic ) admit card and result slip.
Mark sheet and certificate OF ITI if candidate willing to admit in 2nd year ( lateral entry )

College: Shree Tontada Siddhalingeshwara Kalyana Kendra, Gadag
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
He/She is a citizen of India.
He/She should have passed all the subject of the 10th standard.Examination or any other Examination declaired as equivalent there to by the Technical Board is eligible for Diploma Courses.
He/She should have obtained not less than 40% marks in aggregate in Science and Mathematics subjects.The candidates with Junior Technical Schools ,Job Oriented Courses ,I.T.I's shall also score the minimum marks of 40% in aggregate in the prescribed subjects. Minimum marks for the purpose of qualifying Diploma Course shall be 35% in case of candidates belonging to Scheduled caste,Scheduled Tribe,Category A and candidates from rural areas.This minimum marks rule applies in the case of Karnataka Candidates only.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Students are required to pass the 10th standard and any one of the following entrance tests.
• Appear and qualify the Diploma Entrance Test DET entrance exam conducted by Govt Of Orissa, (DTE &T;, Cuttack).
• Appear and qualify the Diploma Entrance Test i.e, OPESA-DET Entrance Test conducted by Odisha Private Engineering Schools Association, OPESA.
• The students who qualify the DET, have to attend the Centralized counseling conducted by the DTE &T; and take admission as per the DET Rank.
• The Students who qualify the OPESA-DET will have to attend the counseling conducted by OPESA and take admission accordingly.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1. Candidate should be an Indian National.
2. Candidate should have passed the SSC (Std.X) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination, with subjects Maths/Mathematics, General Science and English, with minimum 35% marks in aggregate.
Direct to admission 3rd semester / second year applicable only for Engineering & technology diploma : A candidate passing H.S.C. examination (standard 12th) with Science, technical subjects, bifocal course, MCVC of the board of secondary & higher secondary education shall be eligible for direct to 3rd semester for semester pattern courses or second year for yearly pattern course of a diploma course engineering and technology, against the seats created solely for this purpose, subject to the conditions hear under.
a. He/she has passed STD 12th with minimum qualification marks as notified by admission authority with Science or in vocational/technical subjects.
b. A candidate passing ITI examination with minimum qualification marks as notified by admission authority, after passing SSC with and in English, science & mathematics subjects.
c. A candidate passing STD 12th examination with MCVC with minimum qualifying marks as notified by government from time to time.
d. All such eligible candidates will gate admission to 3rd semester for semester pattern courses or second year for yearly pattern courses in respective diploma courses only.
e. Any other conditions that my be prescribed by government & ABIT at the time of this admissions.
f. Eligibility for direct admission & backlog subjects of the first year diploma to be passed will be as per the rules of M.S.B.T.E., Mumbai.

Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Candidates have passed the 10th standard examination (Academic Stream) prescribed by the government of Tamil Nadu or any examination of any other Board or authority accepted by the Directorate of Technical Education as equivalent thereto.
Eligibility for II year Diploma Admission (Under lateral entry Scheme)
Candidates have passed the Higher Secondary Examination of (10+2) curriculum (academic stream) prescribed by the government of Tamil Nadu with Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry as three of the four subjects of study under part-III.
(or)
Candidates have passed the Higher Secondary Examination of Vocational stream with Mathematics / Physics / Chemistry.
(or)
Candidates have passed both 10th standard and ITI (2 years course).
